content: The following lists events that happened during **1986 in Singapore**. ## Incumbents - [President](/wiki/President_of_Singapore): [Wee Kim Wee](/wiki/Wee_Kim_Wee) - [Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore): [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) ## Events ### January - January – The [Ministry of Education](/wiki/Ministry_of_Education_(Singapore)) introduces a Single Session System for schools. - 18 January – [NETS](/wiki/NETS_(company)) was officially launched in Singapore, allowing people to pay electronically instead of using cash. ### March - 15 March – [Hotel New World collapses](/wiki/Collapse_of_Hotel_New_World), killing 33 people and leaving 17 injured. ### June - 17 June – The [National University Hospital](/wiki/National_University_Hospital) is officially opened. ### July - 8 July – The first MRT train is delivered to [Bishan Depot](/wiki/Bishan_Depot). ### September - 1 September – The first [Town Councils](/wiki/Town_Council#Singapore) are established. ### October - 3 October – [Raffles City](/wiki/Raffles_City_Singapore), a mixed-use development, is officially opened. During the opening, several proposals to revamp tourism attractions are announced, including upgrading [Haw Par Villa](/wiki/Haw_Par_Villa), enhancing historic areas like [Chinatown](/wiki/Chinatown,_Singapore) and [Bugis](/wiki/Bugis,_Singapore), a heritage link in the city, revamp of [Sentosa](/wiki/Sentosa) and [Fort Canning Park](/wiki/Fort_Canning_Park), and hosting more sports and cultural events. ### November - 13 November – [Wisma Atria](/wiki/Wisma_Atria) opens to the public. - 18–20 November – [Chaim Herzog](/wiki/Chaim_Herzog) visits Singapore. - 30 November – The first episode of [Crimewatch](/wiki/Crimewatch_(Singaporean_TV_series)) is shown on [SBC 5](/wiki/Channel_5_(Singaporean_TV_channel)). ## Births - 5 May – [Dawn Yeoh](/wiki/Dawn_Yeoh), actress. - 5 August – [Oon Shu An](/wiki/Oon_Shu_An), actress and host. - 19 August – [Desmond Tan](/wiki/Desmond_Tan_(actor)), actor. - 26 September – [Rebecca Lim](/wiki/Rebecca_Lim), actress. - 17 October – [Nicole Seah](/wiki/Nicole_Seah), politician. ## Deaths - 15 May – Chou Sing Chu, founder of [Popular Bookstore](/wiki/Popular_Holdings) (b. 1905). - 15 September – [William Goode](/wiki/William_Goode_(colonial_administrator)), last [Governor of Singapore](/wiki/List_of_governors_of_Singapore) (b. 1907). - 15 October – [Alex Josey](/wiki/Alex_Josey), journalist and writer (b. 1910). - 14 December – [Teh Cheang Wan](/wiki/Teh_Cheang_Wan), former [Minister for National Development](/wiki/Ministry_of_National_Development_(Singapore)) (b. 1928). This Singapore-related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: 1986 in Singapore
